parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To condemn, judge worthy of punishment. From kata and krino; to judge against, i.e. Sentence.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Sodom. Plural of Hebrew origin; Sodoma, a place in Palestine.
Gomorrah, one of the destroyed cities on the Dead Sea. Of Hebrew origin; Gomorrha, a place near the Dead Sea.
Overthrow, destruction, material or spiritual. From katastrepho; an overturn, i.e. Demolition; figuratively, apostasy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To reduce to ashes, consume, destroy. From tephra; to incinerate, i.e. Consume.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To put, place, lay, set, fix, establish. A prolonged form of a primary theo to place.
(a) a figure, copy, (b) an example, model. From hupodeiknumi; an exhibit for imitation or warning.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
Impious, ungodly, wicked. Irreverent, i.e. impious or wicked.
